conditions.name: Safety Review for Dose Titration
conditions.description: Safety Review Committee (SRC) must review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant before dose titration.
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: Outpatient Period Extension
conditions.description: The Outpatient Period may be extended for up to 14 additional days with Investigator approval.
conditions.text: To ensure flexibility, the Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval.

conditions.name: ALT/AST Elevation (> 5x ULN)
conditions.description: Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) or aspartate aminotransferase (AST) is greater than 5 times the upper limit of normal (ULN).

conditions.name: ALT/AST Elevation (> 3 to 5x ULN)
conditions.description: Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) or aspartate aminotransferase (AST) is greater than 3 times and up to 5 times the upper limit of normal (ULN).

conditions.name: Potential Liver Injury (Hy's Law)
conditions.description: Bilirubin is greater than 2 times ULN, accompanied by ALT greater than 3 times ULN.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN Accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN, indicative of liver injury

conditions.name: Anemia Trigger
conditions.description: Hemoglobin is less than 10 g/dL or has decreased by more than 2 g/dL from baseline.
conditions.text: Hemoglobin < 10 g/dL or > 2 g/dL ↓ from baseline

conditions.name: Thrombocytopenia Trigger
conditions.description: Platelets are less than 100,000/mm3 or have decreased by more than 30% from baseline.

conditions.name: Neutropenia Trigger
conditions.description: Neutrophils have decreased by more than 30% from baseline and are below the reference range.
conditions.text: Neutrophils > 30% ↓ from baseline and below reference range at baseline

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of neurologic worsening by Adverse Events or by neurologic physical exam assessment.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening

conditions.name: Rechallenge Limit
conditions.description: A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed following dose modification or interruption.
conditions.text: A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed.

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30 mg/day
transitionRules.text: Following the Run-in Period, participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day for a treatment period of approximately 28 days followed by titration up to 30 mg/day on Day 29.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for ALT/AST > 3-5x ULN
transitionRules.text: If ALT/AST is > 3 to 5 x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing. Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD when ALT/AST is < 3 x ULN.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for ALT/AST > 5x ULN
transitionRules.text: If ALT/AST is > 5 x ULN, discontinue ALXN1840. Rechallenge is not recommended.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Hematologic Abnormalities
transitionRules.text: For specified decreases in Hemoglobin, Platelets, or Neutrophils, reduce dose to previous dose level or to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Potential Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2x ULN and ALT > 3x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing. Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD or less when bilirubin is below ULN, with Medical Monitor approval.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic/Psychiatric Worsening
transitionRules.text: Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease) based on neurologic or psychiatric worsening.

transitionRules.name: General Discontinuation Criteria
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for: Serious hypersensitivity reaction; Severe uncontrolled infection; Use of disallowed medication; Pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request, or may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site after documented attempts.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor-Initiated Study Termination
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time for any reason at the sole discretion of Alexion.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Site Closure
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A study site may be closed early for reasons including failure to comply with protocol, inadequate recruitment, or discontinuation of study intervention development.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Titration Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point prior to Day 29 based on safety data review through Day 23 to determine if participant can titrate from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Ongoing Safety-Based Dose Modification
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing monitoring for safety events that trigger dose modification (interruption, reduction) or discontinuation as per protocol criteria.
